ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class LightLocalization

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.LightLocalization

  • public class LightLocalization
extends java.lang.Object
    LightLocalization leverages the readings of both left and right light sensors to snap to perpendicular gridlines. This is primarily used to correct the theta odometry value, which will then improve ultrasonic localization.
    Author:
    Dimitrios Sinodinos, Minh Quan Hoang

      • localize

        public static void localize()
        Initial localization routine. Once ultrasonic localization terminates, the robot will proceed to move forward to the front-facing perpendicular line until both sensors touch the line. If one touches before, the the motor to the side of that color sensor will turn off, allowing the other color sensor to align as well. Next, the robot will move forward a fixed distance to align the wheel base with the line. It will then rotate to 90 degrees, move to the next line, then turn to 0 degrees. This will ensure a perfect localization to (1,1).

      • relocalize

        public static void relocalize()
